meanings.definition: A person who is excessively self-centered and believes they are superior to others.
meanings.sent1: Some egotists only care about themselves and think they are better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: Egotists often talk about themselves and ignore the feelings of others.
meanings.sent3: The egotists at the party only wanted to talk about their own achievements.
meanings.sent4: Her boss was such an egotist, always boasting about his success without considering his team.
meanings.sent5: The egotists in the group always made sure the conversation revolved around them.

meanings.definition: The behavior or attitude of being excessively self-centered and believing one is superior to others.
meanings.sent1: His egotists often led to conflicts with his colleagues who felt he was too arrogant.
meanings.sent2: Egotists tend to alienate others with their constant need for attention and praise.
meanings.sent3: The egotists in the office always wanted to be the center of attention during meetings.
meanings.sent4: The company's culture of egotists made collaboration difficult and hindered progress.
meanings.sent5: The egotists' behavior created a toxic environment where teamwork was impossible.
